intro: Erigeron bloomeri var. typicus, commonly known as the desert blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its blue to purple composite flowers and hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its compact growth habit and drought tolerance make it a resilient species in harsh climates.
